justification: The package com.google.googlejavaformat.intellij has stability of 1.0 (Ce=1, Ca=0), while its dependency com.google.googlejavaformat.java has stability of 0.5 (Ce=2, Ca=2). Since the dependent package (0.5) is less stable than the depending package (1.0), this follows the Stable Dependencies Principle correctly.

The package com.google.googlejavaformat.java has outgoing dependencies to com.google.googlejavaformat and com.google.googlejavaformat.java.javadoc. Both of these packages have Ce=0 and Ca=1, making them more stable than the current package (which has Ce=2 and Ca=2). Since com.google.googlejavaformat.java only depends on packages that are more stable than itself, it does not exhibit the Unstable Dependency smell.

The package com.google.googlejavaformat.java.filer has outgoing dependency to com.google.googlejavaformat.java. The stability of com.google.googlejavaformat.java.filer is 1.0 (Ce=1, Ca=0, so instability = Ce/(Ce+Ca) = 1/(1+0) = 1.0), while the stability of com.google.googlejavaformat.java is 0.5 (Ce=2, Ca=2, so instability = 2/(2+2) = 0.5). Since the dependent package (com.google.googlejavaformat.java.filer with instability 1.0) is more unstable than the package it depends on (com.google.googlejavaformat.java with instability 0.5), this follows the Stable Dependencies Principle and does not constitute an Unstable Dependency smell.

Package com.google.googlejavaformat has stability of 1.0 (Ce=0, Ca=1), making it maximally stable. It has no outgoing dependencies, so there are no unstable dependencies to evaluate. The package is only depended upon by com.google.googlejavaformat.java which has lower stability (Ce=2, Ca=2), but this represents a stable dependency from the perspective of com.google.googlejavaformat since it is the more stable package.

The package has no outgoing dependencies (Ce=0), which means it doesn't depend on any other packages. Since there are no dependencies to evaluate for stability violations, there is no unstable dependency smell. The package is stable (I=1.0) as it has incoming dependencies but no outgoing dependencies.
